meta.content: Phase-controlled synthesis of thermally stable nitrogen-doped carbon supported iron catalysts for highly efficient Fischer-Tropsch synthesis
meta.name: dc.title

meta.content: Nano Research 2019 12:10
meta.name: dc.source

meta.content: 2019 Tsinghua University Press and Springer-Verlag GmbH Germany, part of Springer Nature
meta.name: dc.copyright

meta.content: Iron-based nanoparticles with uniform and high particle dispersion, which are supported on carbon structures, have been used for various applications. However, their preparation still suffers from complicated synthesis involving multiple steps and from the high price of precursors and solvents. In the present work, a new carbon encapsulated iron-carbide nanoparticle supported on nitrogen-doped porous carbon (Fe5C2@C/NPC) structure was introduced. It was made using a simple solid-state reaction with sequential thermal treatments. Fe5C2@C/NPC is a highly active and stable catalyst for the high-temperature Fischer-Tropsch synthesis reaction. It showed very high hydrocarbon productivity (4.71 gHC·gcat−1·h−1) with high CO conversions (up to 96%).

meta.content: Phase-controlled synthesis of thermally stable nitrogen-doped carbon supported iron catalysts for highly efficient Fischer-Tropsch synthesis - Nano Research

Iron-based nanoparticles with uniform and high particle dispersion, which are supported on carbon structures, have been used for various applications. However, their preparation still suffers from complicated synthesis involving multiple steps and from the high price of precursors and solvents. In the present work, a new carbon encapsulated iron-carbide nanoparticle supported on nitrogen-doped porous carbon (Fe5C2@C/NPC) structure was introduced. It was made using a simple solid-state reaction with sequential thermal treatments. Fe5C2@C/NPC is a highly active and stable catalyst for the high-temperature Fischer-Tropsch synthesis reaction. It showed very high hydrocarbon productivity (4.71 gHC·gcat−1·h−1) with high CO conversions (up to 96%).

head.title: Phase-controlled synthesis of thermally stable nitrogen-doped carbon supported iron catalysts for highly efficient Fischer-Tropsch synthesis | SpringerLink

div.div: Phase-controlled synthesis of thermally stable nitrogen-doped carbon supported iron catalysts for highly efficient Fischer-Tropsch synthesis

header.h1: Phase-controlled synthesis of thermally stable nitrogen-doped carbon supported iron catalysts for highly efficient Fischer-Tropsch synthesis
header.p:
Nano Research
volume
12
,
pages
2568–2575 (
2019
)
Cite this article

li.p:
420
Accesses

9
Citations

div.p:
Iron-based nanoparticles with uniform and high particle dispersion, which are supported on carbon structures, have been used for various applications. However, their preparation still suffers from complicated synthesis involving multiple steps and from the high price of precursors and solvents. In the present work, a new carbon encapsulated iron-carbide nanoparticle supported on nitrogen-doped porous carbon (Fe
5
C
2
@C/NPC) structure was introduced. It was made using a simple solid-state reaction with sequential thermal treatments. Fe
5
C
2
@C/NPC is a highly active and stable catalyst for the high-temperature Fischer-Tropsch synthesis reaction. It showed very high hydrocarbon productivity (4.71 g
HC
·g
cat
−1
·h
−1
) with high CO conversions (up to 96%).

Download
to read the full article text
